result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to 22-CF-432 and 22-CM-206.
180 days served if revoked.
DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees.**
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No THC. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.**
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.**
**Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.**
Probation & Parole to notify the Court, in writing, upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs. Comply with all doctors orders.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. On state's motion counts 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed. DE pleads guilty to count 2. Court finds DE guilty of count 2. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions; credit for 180 days served if revoked; concurrent to 22CF432 and 22CM206. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court. DE is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. During the plea colloquy the DE seemed to be having some trouble. DE's mother in court and states she does not believe the DE is thinking clearly.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Hans Peter Koesser in court for Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo. Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared by video, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke.  Attorney Koesser asks for a new date. Corresponding case should be transferred back to br 2 from br 6.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Case to be in br 2 with all the corresponding cases. RCOC entered to br 2 and the date of 09/14/22 at 2:30 is set with the other cases.

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State by zoom.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Koesser.  Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Koesser's bond motion. For reasons set forth on the record the bond motion is denied.

Defendant Leah T. Mendoza-Castillo appeared with Attorney Hans Peter Koesser.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Atty Koesser moves to dismiss complaint; arguments heard; Court takes motion under advisement.    ST called witness  KSD Dep Keith Kirwan; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Koesser. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard.  Court denies motion to dismisses.  Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to attorney in court today. Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
With Attorney Koesser a MH has been set to 07/08/22 at 10:30 on the Bond Motion.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Deborah O - except for incidental.

144PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Chad Shamali.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am. $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
and witness list filed by the State
